feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: Operational reality summary for "daily wage calculator" based on Jira evidence: - Findings / issues / limitations: 3 - Troubleshooting / edge cases / requests: 2 - Evidence suggests asynchronous updates or synchronization considerations. - Evidence includes UI/visibility or copy/label concerns.

findings.group_description: Daily wage calculations involve complex configurations with multiple potential divisors and calculation methods
findings.issue_explanation: System supports multiple daily wage calculation approaches: basic salary divided by 30, 30.42, or working days, with global and policy-level configurations
findings.limitation_statement: Platform lacks transparent, unified daily wage calculation methodology across different scenarios

findings.group_description: Inconsistent handling of leap year days in service duration and gratuity calculations
findings.issue_explanation: System sometimes fails to correctly account for 366 days in leap years, potentially causing miscalculations in service duration
findings.limitation_statement: Gratuity and service duration calculations do not consistently recognize leap year day variations

findings.group_description: Unpaid leave deductions involve intricate calculation rules with multiple configuration layers
findings.issue_explanation: Global configurations can override policy-specific leave deduction calculations, creating potential misalignments
findings.limitation_statement: Leave deduction calculations are not transparently configurable at policy level

troubleshooting.group_description: Strategies for handling discrepancies in daily wage calculations
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution:
1. Verify global daily rate configuration before policy-level settings
2. Check work week and public holiday configurations
3. Use manual deduction for complex scenarios
4. Confirm salary configuration timing relative to leave requests

troubleshooting.group_description: Managing leave requests across different system modules
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution:
1. Ensure leave requests are created before payroll processing
2. Verify public holiday configurations before leave submission
3. Use conditional accrual policies for more flexible leave tracking
4. Manually adjust leave balances if system synchronization fails

glossary.definition: The number of days used to calculate an employee's daily rate, which can vary between 30, 30.42, or working days depending on system configuration
Days considered productive, excluding weekends and public holidays, which can be configured differently across organizations
